action.action-desc: Mr. Moylan (for himself, Mrs. Radewagen, Mrs. González-Colón, Ms. Mace, Ms. Plaskett, Mr. Sablan, Mr. Ciscomani, Mr. Hunt, Mr. Langworthy, Mr. Mills, and Mr. Strong) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To permit the territories of the United States to provide and furnish statues for placement in National Statuary Hall.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Equality in the Halls of Congress Act.

section.header: Placement of statues from territories in National Statuary Hall

subsection.text: Section 1814 of the Revised Statutes of the United States (2 U.S.C. 2131) is amended by adding at the end the following new sentence: For purposes of this section, the term State includes American Samoa, Guam, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and the United States Virgin Islands..

subsection.header: Conforming amendment relating to replacement of statues
subsection.text: Section 311 of the Legislative Branch Appropriations Act, 2001 (2 U.S.C. 2132) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
For purposes of this section, the term State includes American Samoa, Guam, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and the United States Virgin Islands.
